Detailed Description

IMA Intel/DVI type ADPCM encoder and decoder.

Author:
Phil Burk, Copyright 1997-2005 Phil Burk, Mobileer, PROPRIETARY and CONFIDENTIAL

Function Documentation

int IMA_DecodeArray ( const unsigned char *  encodedArray,
int  numSamples,
short  initialValue,
int  initialStepIndex,
short *  decodedArray 
)

Decode an array of packed IMA Intel/DVI ADPCM data into an array of shorts.

Set initialValue and initialStepIndex which may come from block headers in an encoded stream.

Parameters:
numSamples Two samples per byte of encodedArray.
initialValue Typically 0
initialStepIndex Value between 0 and 88, typically 0
decodedArray Output array must be large enough for numSamples.
Returns:
final stepIndex;

short IMA_DecodeNibble ( unsigned char  encodedSample,
short  previousValue,
int *  stepIndexPtr 
)

Decode one 4 bit nibble of ADPCM data.

void IMA_EncodeArray ( const short *  decodedArray,
int  numSamples,
short *  previousSamplePtr,
int *  stepIndexPtr,
unsigned char *  encodedArray 
)

Encode an array of packed IMA Intel/DVI ADPCM data from an array of shorts.

Parameters:
decodedArray Input array of uncompresed samples.
numSamples 
previousSamplePtr pointer to previousSample whose value is used then updated with decoded value.
stepIndexPtr pointer to step index whose value is used then updated
encodedArray Two samples per byte of encodedArray.
Returns:
final stepIndex;

unsigned char IMA_EncodeNibble ( short  inputSample,
short *  previousSamplePtr,
int *  stepIndexPtr
